jobDescription: GENERAL SUMMARY Under supervision of the Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead, uses tools, protocols, and programming languages to develop business intelligence solutions. Develops, formats, and maintains the Airport’s business intelligence solutions. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITESWorks with business users and technical staff to gather requirements from customers using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshop, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, uses cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task/workflow analysis to define and fulfill business intelligence needs.Creates business requirements documentation as well as functional and reporting specifications; captures and documents uses cases, creates process flow diagrams, and participates in the creation of user interfaces and conceptual and logical data models.Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, abstracts up from low-level information to a general understanding, and works with customers to uncover unmet business needs.Participates in the complete development lifecycle, including planning and estimating, analysis, design, build, and test (functional, users acceptance, regression and performance).Collaborates with other technical staff to develop effective designs and solutions that are optimized for analytical reporting.Assists with data modeling efforts to verify correctness and completeness of the data model, data relationships, mappings, and definitions for the functional business area.Participates in definition of business rules and transformations for data coming from source systems in the data warehouse.Assists with the identification and resolution of data quality issues.Trains and mentors end users in the creation and maintenance of analytical reports, key metrics, and statistical reports.Leverages the strengths and stability of enterprise relational database with an emphasis on Oracle database.Participates in the effort to establish and maintain custom application development policies and standards with ITS.Documents, mentors and trains other developers within ITS in the use of new or enhanced technology.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTSBachelor’s degree in business administration, computer science, or a related field.Five (5) years of experience developing business intelligence solutions.Any equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be substituted for the above.Possession of a valid class C driver’s license.REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIESExperience creating analytical reports, key metrics, statistical reports, and dashboards.Ability to create, interpret, and analyze ERD’s and complex data models.Experience with data warehousing and data mining.Knowledge of the principles and practices of systems analysis, and design, including software development and documentation.Working knowledge of SQL.Working knowledge of financial and statistical analysis.Ability to plan and develop time and cost estimates for projects.Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing, at all levels within and outside the organization and to provide technical documentation.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships inside and outside the organization.DESIRABLEExperience with a third party business intelligence tool such as MicroStrategy, Business Objects, Crystal Reports, or comparable.Experience creating Executive Level Dashboards and analytical reports.Knowledge of Full Software Design Life Cycle (SDLC).Knowledge of Object Oriented design methodology.Ability to perform advanced SQL tuning
